alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 3:20PM EST until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River at Smithfield. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to rise tonight and is expected to rise above flood stage by mid morning Thursday. The river will continue rising to around 15.9 feet on Friday evening and will likely remain near that level for a few days. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 14.1 Wed 2 pm EST 15.2 15.8 15.9 15.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks or along greenways or parks near the Neuse or its tributaries. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EST.
